thread.title: Umpire to announce future of weekend penalty rates
thread.title_full: Umpire to announce future of weekend penalty rates

author: Nick Toscano
title: Umpire to announce future of weekend penalty rates
text:
Hackett gives thanks, seeks help Hackett gives thanks, seeks help 
Grant Hackett says he will seek help for serious mental health issues after the "toughest week of my life". Nine News More videos The rate debate 
Changes to penalty rates have long been protested and debated. This is where it currently sits, and what might change. 
Employer groups argue penalty rates of up to 200 per cent on Sundays are too high, no longer reflect community standards and are forcing businesses to close their doors on weekends and holidays. 
Trade unions, meanwhile, have fiercely opposed any cuts, saying penalty rates provide critical and fair compensation for low-paid Australians who work unsociable hours. SHARE
